api_info.title: HTTPX SDK
api_info.description: An HTTP client for Python, providing a clean, modern, and easy-to-use API for making HTTP requests.

params.name: method
params.description: HTTP method for the new `Request` object: `GET`, `OPTIONS`, `HEAD`, `POST`, `PUT`, `PATCH`, or `DELETE`.

params.name: url
params.description: URL for the new `Request` object.

params.name: params
params.description: Query parameters to include in the URL, as a string, dictionary, or sequence of two-tuples.

params.name: content
params.description: Binary content to include in the body of the request, as bytes or a byte iterator.

params.name: data
params.description: Form data to include in the body of the request, as a dictionary.

params.name: files
params.description: A dictionary of upload files to include in the body of the request.

params.name: json
params.description: A JSON serializable object to include in the body of the request.

params.name: headers
params.description: Dictionary of HTTP headers to include in the request.

params.name: cookies
params.description: Dictionary of Cookie items to include in the request.

params.name: auth
params.description: An authentication class to use when sending the request.

params.name: proxy
params.description: A proxy URL where all the traffic should be routed.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout configuration to use when sending the request.

params.name: follow_redirects
params.description: Enables or disables HTTP redirects.

params.name: verify
params.description: Either `True` to use an SSL context with the default CA bundle, `False` to disable verification, or an instance of `ssl.SSLContext` to use a custom context.

params.name: trust_env
params.description: Enables or disables usage of environment variables for configuration.

tools.name: httpx.stream
tools.description: Alternative to `httpx.request()` that streams the response body instead of loading it into memory at once.

tools.name: httpx.Client
tools.description: An HTTP client, with connection pooling, HTTP/2, redirects, cookie persistence, etc.

params.name: auth
params.description: An authentication class to use when sending requests.

params.name: params
params.description: Query parameters to include in request URLs, as a string, dictionary, or sequence of two-tuples.

params.name: headers
params.description: Dictionary of HTTP headers to include when sending requests.

params.name: cookies
params.description: Dictionary of Cookie items to include when sending requests.

params.name: verify
params.description: Either `True` to use an SSL context with the default CA bundle, `False` to disable verification, or an instance of `ssl.SSLContext` to use a custom context.

params.name: cert
params.description: Client SSL certificate, either path to a file or tuple of (cert, key) paths.

params.name: trust_env
params.description: Enables or disables usage of environment variables for configuration.

params.name: http1
params.description: A boolean indicating if HTTP/1.1 support should be enabled. Defaults to `True`.

params.name: http2
params.description: A boolean indicating if HTTP/2 support should be enabled. Defaults to `False`.

params.name: proxy
params.description: A proxy URL where all the traffic should be routed.

params.name: mounts
params.description: A mapping of URL patterns to HTTP transports.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout configuration to use when sending requests.

params.name: follow_redirects
params.description: A boolean indicating if redirects should be followed.

params.name: limits
params.description: The limits configuration to use.

params.name: max_redirects
params.description: The maximum number of redirect responses that should be followed.

params.name: event_hooks
params.description: A mapping of event names to a list of callables for request/response hooks.

params.name: base_url
params.description: A URL to use as the base when building request URLs.

params.name: transport
params.description: A transport class to use for sending requests over the network.

params.name: default_encoding
params.description: The default encoding to use for decoding response text, if no charset information is included in a response Content-Type header. Set to a callable for automatic character set detection. Default: 'utf-8'.

params.name: method
params.description: The HTTP method for the request (e.g., 'GET', 'POST').

params.name: url
params.description: The URL for the request, as a string or a `httpx.URL` object.

params.name: content
params.description: The request body as bytes.

params.name: data
params.description: The request body as form data (dict or list of tuples).

params.name: files
params.description: Files to upload (dict or list of tuples).

params.name: json
params.description: The request body as JSON.

params.name: params
params.description: Query parameters to include in the URL.

params.name: headers
params.description: HTTP headers to include in the request.

params.name: cookies
params.description: Cookie values to include in the request.

params.name: auth
params.description: Authentication class to use for this request, overriding client-level auth.

params.name: follow_redirects
params.description: Whether to follow redirects for this request, overriding client-level setting.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The timeout configuration for this request, overriding client-level timeout.

params.name: extensions
params.description: A dictionary of extensions to modify request behavior.

tools.name: httpx.Client.stream
tools.description: Alternative to `httpx.request()` that streams the response body instead of loading it into memory at once.
